intro: Hieracium cirritoides, commonly known as the cirratoid hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium cirritoides is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
